hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Gap Fill After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, price gaps of >5% created by illiquid overnight moves will be filled within 3 trading days with >70% probability, as market makers re-establish continuous pricing.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In post-liquidity crash environments, gaps represent pricing discontinuities rather than fundamental shifts. Market makers and arbitrageurs have strong incentive to fill these gaps for risk-free profits. Low volume confirms gap was liquidity-driven rather than information-driven.
entry_conditions: Gap occurs during low liquidity hours (00:00-04:00 UTC)
Volume on gap day < 30-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-gap level ±0.5% (gap filled)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves another 3% in gap direction (momentum continuation)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of such gaps fill within 3 days during STRESS regimes, indicating structural change in market maker behavior.
